name: Samosa Wraps - Spiced Potato Chickpea Chutney Burrito
description: Samosa Wraps - Spiced Potatoes, Chickpeas, Chutney Burrito. Easy Spiced Potato Chickpea Burrito for lunch, picnic or carry out. Vegan Nutfree Soyfree Recipe  Easily Glutenfree

video.name: SAMOSA WRAPS â€“ SPICED POTATO CHICKPEA CHUTNEY BURRITO
video.description:
Samosa Wraps â€“ Spiced Potatoes, Chickpeas, Chutney Burrito. 
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2018/08/samosa-wraps-spiced-potato-chickpea-burrito.html
MY BOOKS: https://veganricha.com/mybooks

When you want Samosa for lunch, this Samosa Wrap works out amazingly! Make the Samosa Potato mixture. Add some mint chutney or chopped up mint into it. Spice up the cooked chickpeas in a skillet. Layer with chopped tomato, onion, chutney and lettuce or greens, fold and done.  No pastry making, no frying! 

You can pair the wrap with chutneys such as tamarind chutney, mint cilantro or mango chutney. Layer with spiced beans or chickpeas. All amazing flavors that work so well together. These wraps can be made ahead and store well in the refrigerator or freezer. 
Try this Easy Spiced Potato Chickpea Burrito for lunch, picnic or carry out. Vegan Nutfree Soyfree Recipe  Easily Glutenfree

recipeIngredient: 1/2  serrano pepper, chopped or other hot or mild green chili pepper ((optional))
1/2 to 1 tsp ground cumin (, preferably roasted)
1/2 tsp chaat masala ( or 1/2 tsp amchur ( dry mango powder))
2 tbsp cilantro mint chutney ((or chop a handful of cilantro and mint finely and mix in))
1/2 tsp each of ground cumin (, coriander, garlic powder)
1/4 tsp ground cinnamon (, cayenne, ginger powder)
1/3 tsp salt (, less or more depending on if the chickpeas are already salted)

recipeInstructions.text: Samosa Mixture: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add cumin and coriander seeds and cook until they change to a deeper color. Add the Serrano pepper and cook for a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Samosa Mixture: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add cumin and coriander seeds and cook until they change to a deeper color. Add the Serrano pepper and cook for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add all the spices and mix in. Add the mashed potatoes, salt and mix in. Break any larger pieces. Cover and cook for 2 mins.
recipeInstructions.name: Add all the spices and mix in. Add the mashed potatoes, salt and mix in. Break any larger pieces. Cover and cook for 2 mins.

recipeInstructions.text: Add peas, ginger, chutney and mix in. Add chaat masala or amchur(mango powder) or both and mix in. Add more lemon juice if omitting these spices. Taste and adjust salt and flavor. Cover and cook for 2 mins, then let sit for another 2 mins for the flavors to develop.
recipeInstructions.name: Add peas, ginger, chutney and mix in. Add chaat masala or amchur(mango powder) or both and mix in. Add more lemon juice if omitting these spices. Taste and adjust salt and flavor. Cover and cook for 2 mins, then let sit for another 2 mins for the flavors to develop.

recipeInstructions.text: Chickpeas: Heat oil in a skillet. Add the chickpeas and spices and salt and mix well. Cover and cook for 2 mins. Add a good splash of water and mix, cover and cook for another 2-3 mins. Taste and adjust salt and flavor.
recipeInstructions.name: Chickpeas: Heat oil in a skillet. Add the chickpeas and spices and salt and mix well. Cover and cook for 2 mins. Add a good splash of water and mix, cover and cook for another 2-3 mins. Taste and adjust salt and flavor.

recipeInstructions.text: Wraps: Layer any greens if using. Add the potato mixture. Then some chickpeas, chopped tomato, onion and a drizzle of chutney, Wrap it all up by folding in the left and right sides. Then folding he edge closest to you over the filling. Tuck in and tighten, then continue to roll and tuck. Optionally grill the wrap to seal, serve or store. Serve with tamarind chutney, mint cilantro or mango chutney.
recipeInstructions.name: Wraps: Layer any greens if using. Add the potato mixture. Then some chickpeas, chopped tomato, onion and a drizzle of chutney, Wrap it all up by folding in the left and right sides. Then folding he edge closest to you over the filling. Tuck in and tighten, then continue to roll and tuck. Optionally grill the wrap to seal, serve or store. Serve with tamarind chutney, mint cilantro or mango chutney.
